intro: Scorzonera jacquiniana var. alpina, commonly known as the alpine scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and yellow flowers with a distinctive purple-pink ray florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing adaptations to cold and harsh environments. Its tuberous roots are edible and have been used in traditional medicine and cuisine. Scorzonera jacquiniana var. alpina is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in alpine ecosystems.
